author: Pavan Dahat
text:
A Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) jawan was injured in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast near Sameli village in Maoist-hit Dantewada district of South Chhattisgarh on Saturday.

“Janaradan Sonawane, a jawan of the CRPF’s 111 battalion, was part of a security team for the construction of a road in the area,” Dinesh Pratap Upadhyay, Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of the CRPF, Dantewada range told The Hindu .

“He suffered severe injuries on his left leg,” Mr. Upadhyay said.

The jawan is likely to be airlifted to Raipur for treatment.
title: CRPF jawan injured in IED blast
